But I remember their faces. I remember the ones who led them, the ones who gave the orders. I remember their names. And I’ve spent every waking moment since then learning how to make them suffer the way they made us suffer. Not just them—*all* of them. Every last one of their kind. They are all the same. They all share the guilt.

You don’t fix this with words. You don’t heal this with time. You *end* it. You take back what they stole, one life at a time, until there is no one left to carry their hatred forward. Until they are gone. That’s the only justice left. That’s the only peace.
